title: Chapter 103
content: # Chapter 103 A guild member stared at the masked figure. "Mister...?" The Giant Guild members panicked as Grid suddenly pulled out a weapon. Private messages flickered through their party chat. Grey Bear sent another message as the guild debated. The guild members paused. One of the members stepped forward, hands raised in a placating gesture. "Did we disturb your work? We're truly sorry. We will compensate you, so please calm down first and put away your weapon. Then we can talk." He gestured broadly. "We came to invite you to the Giant Guild on Chris' order. How about it? Isn't it an honor? Are you happy? Have some of your upset feelings gone away?" The members exchanged confident glances. They had visited smithies several times and watched the tedious process of item creation. Two to three hours on average. Sometimes longer. The blacksmiths would sit hunched before the flames for three or four hours at a stretch. One or two epic items would emerge every month. Everything else was garbage. This unknown craftsman was probably the same. Slightly better, perhaps. More epics. But still just a production class. Still just a blacksmith. The speaker waved dismissively. "Now, put away your sword. Isn't this too shameful just because we disturbed the production of an item? Hahaha!" Grid's hand tightened on the weapon. "... Just?" He stopped mid-swing. *Kwaduduk.* The sound of grinding teeth filled the smithy. "Just the production of an item?" Grid's voice was low and dangerous. "Have you ever tried making an item? Are you making fun of my class? Have you ever thought about my efforts and perseverance? Huh?" He took a step forward. "You think you can disregard me, just because you're a member of a cool guild?" *Kkuok!* His grip on Dainsleif turned white-knuckled. Battle-ready. Ibellin dragged himself upright, health bar flickering in the red. The Fighter's Beliefs passive had saved him. Barely. He opened a whisper channel. *Grid, calm down first. There are 12 people! Grid will be hurt if you fight alone! Please buy time until I recover!* Ibellin had seen Grid's strength during the Malacus raid. The masked man was powerful. Strong. But twelve opponents, all estimated above **Level 150**? Grid was only **Level 97**. The math didn't work. No chance of winning a twelve-against-one fight. But Grid's jaw set behind the grotesque skull helm. "These jerks..." He rolled his shoulders. "I don't like your tone even when you are apologizing. I will kill you." Grey Bear clicked his tongue. *Really dumb. The silly words of these idiots stimulated the craftsman.* Their orders had been clear. Persuade or kidnap Grid while the main Tzedakah force was occupied. But their team leader had died twice to Ibellin and been forcefully logged out. No one was in charge. No one to negotiate properly. Grey Bear shrugged internally. *Doesn't matter.* The opponent was a blacksmith. The bizarre helmet and greatsword looked threatening, sure. But it was just aesthetics. A blacksmith couldn't actually wield a greatsword effectively. What could he do, really, even angry? If conversation failed, they'd just take him by force. Grey Bear and the Giant Guild prepared to move. Grid took one step forward. *Kwajajak!* "Eh?" Steel cleaved through flesh. The smiles vanished from the Giant Guild members' faces. A player collapsed, health bar plummeting. "Kuaack!" A single blow. No special skills. Just a swing. Their colleague's health dropped below half in one strike. "No way!" The victim was an assassin. High damage, low defense, minimal health pool. But even accounting for that, the attack power was wrong. Blacksmiths weren't damage dealers. They were production classes. Weak attack power. Support roles. But Grid's strike had been devastating. *What is with this blacksmith?* *An assassin is fast. But he was hit without being able to escape. From a blacksmith?* *How can a blacksmith even handle a greatsword properly?* Greatswords required immense strength. Warrior-level stats. This particular weapon looked even larger and heavier than standard models. How was Grid, a blacksmith, wielding it so perfectly? *Damn! What is this?* Grid moved while they processed. The stunned assassin tried to recover. Too slow. *Kwajajak!* > [Your party member Kido has died.] Silence. Two hits. Their colleague was dead from two hits. The Giant Guild stood frozen. Ibellin's eyes widened behind his own helmet. *Strong!* During the Malacus raid, Grid hadn't shown exceptional combat skills. Just high stats. Lucky timing. Good equipment. Ibellin had assumed Grid was primarily a blacksmith with some fighting ability as a bonus. That assessment had been catastrophically wrong. Grid moved like a veteran warrior. Experienced. Skilled. The evaluation was accurate. Grid had spent a year wielding greatswords. Hunting the same low-level area daily. Slow progression. Tedious grinding. But he'd built a solid foundation. Muscle memory. Combat instincts. Those fundamentals had blossomed after acquiring Pagma's Descendant and the corresponding stat bonuses. Dainsleif was the catalyst. *Dainsleif... Great!* Grid checked the weapon stats. --- **Dainsleif (Reproduction)** Rating: Unique Durability: 500/500 Attack Power: 451~635 **(+165)** Attack Speed: -8% * Additional damage equal to 10% of the target's current defense will be dealt. * The greater the number of enemies, the greater the damage. * The skill 'Golden Flash' will be generated. --- *I knew it specialized in fighting multiple enemies, but this much damage...* After Kido's death, the remaining eleven members of the Giant Guild had been flagged as hostiles. Dainsleif responded accordingly. **+165** attack power. Fifteen points per enemy. Against a hundred opponents, that would be **+1,500** attack power. The base maximum attack was **635**. Already one of the strongest weapons in the game. The additional scaling threatened to shatter any semblance of balance. *There must be a cap on the bonus damage. Has to be. But still...* Grid felt a flicker of professional envy. *Compared to my unique items, Dainsleif's performance is outstanding. My skills still haven't reached Albatino.* The creator of Dainsleif was the human blacksmith Albatino. A master craftsman. Yet he'd failed to acquire the title of legend like Pagma. Grid, by contrast, was already legendary by virtue of his class. Pagma's Descendant. But he wasn't as skilled as Albatino. Not yet. *I need to put in more effort. First, I will jump over Albatino and then Pagma. But before that...* He needed to deal with these bastards. "I will make you pay for ruining my item! Blacksmith's Rage!" > [Blacksmith's Rage has been activated. Your attack power and attack speed will increase significantly for 20 seconds.] "Ohhhhhh!" Power flooded Grid's limbs. He swung Dainsleif horizontally. Two Giant Guild members standing adjacent caught the blade simultaneously. *Kwang!* "Kuk!" "What?" They raised weapons and shields defensively. The greatsword's weight drove them backward, boots scraping across stone. The terrible force behind the blow eliminated all doubt. "This... No, he isn't a blacksmith!" Grey Bear's voice cracked. "We were tricked! He isn't the unknown craftsman! These vile Tzedakah people set up a trap!" "Let's get out of here!" They'd walked into an ambush. A setup. The Giant Guild members bolted for the door. Retreat. Survival. Report back. Grid had no intention of letting them escape. "You're trying to run away?" He opened his inventory and pulled the Ideal Dagger free. Quick Movements activated. > [Quick Movements has been activated. Your agility and evasion rate will increase significantly for 1 minute.] "Good." His body felt lighter. Faster. Grid vaulted over the crowd of stunned spectators, using shoulders as stepping stones. He swung Dainsleif downward mid-leap. *Kwajajak!* "Kuaaack!" One of the fleeing members crashed to the ground. System notifications flooded his vision. > [You have been hit by a blow!] > [You have suffered 5,900 damage.] > [The durability of the Adolph Full Plate Armor has decreased by 80.] > [The broken pieces of armor penetrated deep into your body. There will be a continuous bleeding effect until the pieces are removed.] "Cough! This is impossible!" Maksevun stared at his shattered armor in disbelief. He was a pure tank. Every stat point invested into **Stamina**. Maximum defense. Specialized build. But Pagma's Swordsmanship granted Grid **+20%** physical damage and **+10%** critical hit chance passively. Blacksmith's Rage boosted attack power further. Dainsleif's passive added damage equal to **10%** of the target's defense. The numbers stacked. Compounded. Even Maksevun's optimized defense meant nothing. *Even an ogre couldn't endure this blow!* They should have recognized the danger immediately. A blacksmith wielding a greatsword. The unknown craftsman was far stronger than Ibellin, one of the 10 Rookies. Grid was the Tzedakah Guild's hidden weapon. Their ace. *We were wrong.* *We have to escape!* The Giant Guild members abandoned the wounded Maksevun without hesitation. Spectators be damned. They sprinted for the exit. Grid swapped to the Ideal Dagger again. Wind Blast erupted from the blade, cutting off their retreat path. He switched back to Dainsleif mid-stride. "Pagma's Swordsmanship, Wave!" --- *Glossary of Common Korean Terms.* *OG: Glossary Link.* *Current schedule: 20 chapters a week.* *Check out my Patreon for early access to a certain number of unedited chapters and well as achieve the goals for extra chapters. The early access chapters will be updated after I finish releasing all chapters for the day.*
